description: A major terror plot involving multiple vehicle-borne IEDs and rifle attacks has been uncovered in Delhi, with Umar Un Nabi identified as the bomber. The module, linked to a Turkiye-based handler, also targeted Ayodhya. Security agencies are actively searching for two other vehicles and pursuing all involved culprits, with the NIA taking over the investigation.

title: Kayla Nicole reveals truth behind Halloween costume after Swift diss rumors
description: Kayla Nicole clarified her bold Halloween costume, a recreation of Toni Braxton's iconic look, was not a jab at ex Travis Kelce or Taylor Swift. Nicole explained on her podcast that the choice was about personal expression and celebrating a cultural icon, emphasizing her commitment to uplifting other women rather than tearing them down.

description: The cause of death is yet to be ascertained.

title: After a long struggle by residents, Arafath Lake set for rejuvenation
description: Spread over 26.40 acres, the waterbody serves as a major source for ground water recharge in Thirumullaivoyal; it is plagued by sewage ingress and dumping of waste

title: Sensex up 595 pts, exit polls, trade talks lift hope
description: Dalal Street witnessed a significant rally on Wednesday, with Sensex and Nifty closing up by 0.7% each. Positive exit polls from Bihar and progress in US-India trade talks boosted investor sentiment. The end of the US government shutdown also contributed to the global market uplift, positively impacting Indian indices.

title: Before and after Red Fort blast, the 2 clerics arrested, 800 kilometres apart
'No competition': Jurel's message ahead of first South Africa Test
description: Wicketkeeper-batter Dhruv Jurel downplays rivalry with Rishabh Pant, emphasizing their shared goal of winning for India. Jurel, in strong red-ball form, is set to play in the opening Test against South Africa, with assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate confirming his inclusion. The series opener at Eden Gardens promises an exciting battle against strong pace attacks from both sides.

title: Yoga, workout & a double century: How Kohli inspired 1983 WC winner to hit the gym
description: Virat Kohli's dedication to fitness profoundly impacted former cricketer Sandeep Patil. Patil witnessed Kohli's rigorous routine, including early morning yoga and post-match gym sessions, even on a match day in 2016. Inspired by Kohli's encouragement, Patil, then 60, began his own fitness journey.

title: US Government Shutdown Live Updates: US House passes bill to end record government shutdown
At 0.3%, retail inflation hits record low in October
description: Retail inflation hit a record low of 0.3% in October, driven by GST rate cuts and a sharp decline in food prices. This significant drop, the lowest in the current CPI series, has fueled expectations of an interest rate cut by the RBI in December.

title: Worker dies while cleaning STP in Powai, another critically injured
Ajit Pawar dismisses calls for his resignation
Supreme Court flags illegal mining, reserves verdict on single definition of Aravalis
description: The Supreme Court on Wednesday expressed concern over rampant illegal mining in the Aravali range, highlighting its immense damage to the sensitive ecosystem. While reserving verdict on a uniform definition, the court acknowledged the need for sustainable use, with a committee suggesting stringent guidelines for regulated mining alongside conservation efforts.

title: Govt okays Rs 25k crore export mission and extra credit for traders hit by tariffs
description: The Union Cabinet has approved a Rs 25,060 crore Export Promotion Mission and Rs 20,000 crore in additional collateral-free credit to support exporters facing global trade uncertainty. This six-year mission aims to improve access to credit, address logistics costs, and facilitate market access for labor-intensive sectors like textiles and leather.

Ladakh airbase close to China border activated
description: India has boosted its military strength in eastern Ladakh with the operationalization of the new Nyoma airbase. This strategic move enhances troop and supply movement capabilities. Simultaneously, a large Army exercise, 'Poorvi Prachand Prahar', is underway in Arunachal Pradesh. These developments underscore India's high military readiness along the China frontier.

title: Delhi HC refuses J&J arm relief to clear stock of ORSL-labelled beverages
Time to show transparency, says SC on courts reserving verdicts
description: Seven High Courts faced criticism for failing to provide Supreme Court with data on reserved verdicts. The apex court had ordered this information following delays in judgment pronouncements. Justices Kant and Bagchi emphasized transparency, directing the High Courts to submit the compiled data within two weeks or face personal appearance.

title: India 9th among countries worst hit by climate disasters in last 30 years: Report
Wife's love for stray dogs caused stress, led to erectile dysfunction, man tells HC, seeks divorce
description: A man has approached the Gujarat high court seeking a divorce, citing cruelty by his wife who allegedly brought stray dogs into their home, causing public humiliation and distress. The court is reviewing his appeal after a family court dismissed his divorce petition, deeming the wife's actions, including a prank call about an affair, insufficient grounds for divorce.

title: Union Cabinet clears new royalty rates of critical minerals
description: Royalty on graphite has been levied on per tonne basis since 2014.

title: Congress, seven parties decide to form anti-BJP front in Assam
description: The objective is to defeat the Bharatiya Janata Party in the 2026 Assembly elections, Congress leaders said

title: CJI Gavai on 1979 rape ruling: 'Moment of institutional embarrassment'
description: Chief Justice of India BR Gavai called the Supreme Court's 1979 rape ruling a "moment of institutional embarrassment." He acknowledged the verdict, which acquitted policemen by citing the victim's "consent" due to lack of physical resistance, as a failure. This judgment, however, sparked nationwide protests, igniting the women's rights movement and leading to crucial legal reforms.

title: Fifty years ago | Kissinger rules out U.S. exit from U.N.
C.J. Stroud injury update: Texans QB’s return timeline remains uncertain
description: Houston Texans' star quarterback C.J. Stroud is still experiencing concussion symptoms and remains in NFL protocol, ruling him out for Sunday's game against the Tennessee Titans. This marks his second consecutive missed game, with backup Davis Mills preparing to start again. Head coach DeMeco Ryans confirmed Stroud, along with Tytus and Jalen, are progressing through the protocol.

description: The turnover of Tata Steel Ltd. during the quarter grew 12% to ₹34,787 crore from ₹31,137 crore a year ago

title: After US tariff hike, Andhra Pradesh cuts power bill to help shrimp farmers
description: In a bold initiative, Andhra Pradesh is revitalizing its shrimp farming sector by slashing electricity tariffs for farmers. This strategic decision seeks to enhance competitiveness against international players such as Ecuador. Minister Nara Lokesh showcased this impressive cut, while also emphasizing the state's commitment to uncovering new export avenues.

title: Bomb hoaxes keep security personnel at airports on toes
description: Following a recent blast, airports in Delhi and Mumbai, along with three others, received a bomb threat, triggering extensive security searches. The message, received by IndiGo, warned of attacks within 24 hours. While security was already heightened, it was further intensified. After hours of thorough checks, the threat was ultimately deemed a hoax.

Lively's legal team has named Swift as a potential witness in a lawsuit, causing Swift to distance herself. This drama might even lead to Lively and Ryan Reynolds being excluded from Swift's upcoming nuptials with Travis Kelce.

title: Police reveal shocking update in Michael Duarte’s death as influencer’s family faces heartbreak
description: Popular food influencer Michael Duarte, known as FoodWithBearHands, was fatally shot by police in Texas during a disturbance call involving a knife. Duarte, who amassed millions of followers for his cooking videos and charitable aspirations, was pronounced dead at a hospital. His family is seeking support to bring him home and cover funeral expenses.

Emails released by House Democrats have raised questions about Trump's past interactions with Epstein, though the White House dismisses them as a manufactured narrative.

description: India has achieved a remarkable 21% drop in TB cases, yet still represents a quarter of global infections.  Intensified national efforts have significantly boosted diagnosis and treatment coverage, with success rates now exceeding the global average.  This progress, despite the persistent challenge, highlights India's commitment to eradicating the disease.

description: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla formed a 31-member parliamentary committee to scrutinize three bills concerning the removal of PMs, CMs, and ministers under arrest for 30 days. Most opposition parties boycotted the panel, citing constitutional and federalism concerns, with only three opposition MPs joining. The bills propose disqualification upon 30 consecutive days of arrest for serious criminal charges.

description: India's cabinet has approved increased royalty rates for graphite, zirconium, caesium, and rubidium to boost domestic mining and production. This move aims to enhance energy and supply chain security amidst a global scramble for critical minerals. The new ad valorem royalty structure, particularly for graphite, is expected to unlock significant mineral resources, including associated critical minerals like lithium.

This crackdown follows the unearthing of a "white-collar" terror network. Authorities also ordered the attachment of a lawyer's Srinagar home in connection with a 2009 case involving anti-India speeches.

title: Marshawn Kneeland’s cousin shares what he looked forward to before his death
description: Dallas Cowboys player Marshawn Kneeland's family is questioning law enforcement's account of his death, which was ruled a self-inflicted gunshot wound during a police chase. His cousin believes he was murdered, citing his gentle nature and fear.  The family had reunion plans during the team's bye week, adding to their grief.

Buffett's final letter as Berkshire CEO also offers personal reflections on life, learning, and the importance of kindness.

description: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar stated he'll "use his conscience" regarding activist Anjali Damania's resignation demand over a Rs 300-crore Pune land deal involving his son's firm. The government has scrapped the deal and ordered an inquiry. Pawar denies wrongdoing, calling allegations "random accusations" and assuring transparency, while Damania insists a fair probe is impossible with him in office.

title: Delhi blast caught on cam: New video emerges of exact moment when car exploded - watch
description: A devastating car explosion near Delhi's Red Fort, captured on CCTV, has been declared a terrorist incident by the government. The blast killed twelve and injured many, with preliminary findings revealing severe internal injuries. The NIA is investigating a suspected Jaish-e-Mohammad module, collecting DNA samples from the alleged driver's mother.

title: IPL trade: MI knock KKR for Mayank Markande, conversations in final stages | Exclusive
description: With the IPL retention deadline approaching, Mumbai Indians are close to finalising a trade for Kolkata Knight Riders’ leg-spinner Mayank Markande. The move will see the 28-year-old return to his debut franchise after seven years. MI have also shown interest in Rahul Chahar, another former player, as they look to strengthen their spin attack ahead of IPL 2026.

title: NIA conducts searches across five States in Al-Qaeda Gujarat terror conspiracy case
description: The searches were carried out on premises linked to various suspects and their associates in West Bengal, Tripura, Meghalaya, Haryana, and Gujarat. Several digital devices and  documents were seized

title: India, Botswana announce cheetah translocation pact; President Murmu says ‘will take good care of them’
description: The two heads of State will preside over an event where five of the eight captured cheetahs will be released into a quarantine facility at Mokolodi nature reserve, marking the symbolic handing over of the hunting cats to India by Botswana as part of ‘Project Cheetah’ and under a mutual initiative for wildlife conservation

description: With an aim to curb teen pregnancies, child abuse, and child marriages, seven departments have issued a joint circular asking authorities concerned to initiate a slew of measures

description: The other group of conflict zone photographers who were honoured at HIPA came from Syria who have been capturing images of Syria over the past twelve years as rebels clashed with the now deposed government of President Assad

title: Islamabad blast: 8 Sri Lanka cricketers return from Pak; second ODI in doubt
description: Pakistan won the first ODI by six runs at the same venue on Tuesday. Sri Lanka is also scheduled to play a triangular series with Pakistan and Zimbabwe after the ODI series. In 2009, the Sri Lankan team bus was attacked by gunmen on the way to the Gaddafi Stadium in Lahore for the second Test.

description: Apple and ISSEY MIYAKE unveil the iPhone Pocket, a unique 3D-knitted accessory. This wearable textile, crafted in Japan, holds iPhones and other small essentials. It expands to fit devices and allows glimpses of the screen. Available in various colours and strap lengths, it offers both style and utility. The product launches on November 14, 2025, in select global markets.

description: Pakistan's National Assembly has passed a significant constitutional amendment. This bill grants extensive powers to the army chief, Asim Munir, and reshapes the country's judicial system. The legislation, which received overwhelming support, aims to consolidate control over key defense and judicial institutions. It establishes a new federal constitutional court and elevates the army chief's authority over all three military branches.

description: India is set to boost its critical mineral production by rationalizing royalty rates for graphite, caesium, rubidium, and zirconium. This move, approved by the Union Cabinet, aims to reduce import dependency and strengthen supply chains, especially as China imposes export restrictions.

The explosion tragically claimed twelve lives.

Delhi blast: Explosion threw victims against wall; autopsies reveal ruptured lungs
description: A deadly car explosion near Delhi's Red Fort on Monday evening killed at least 12 people. Post-mortem reports reveal severe injuries, including ruptured organs and multiple fractures, indicating a high-intensity blast. The National Investigation Agency has taken over the terror-related incident probe.

title: From Umar to Muzammil: Who are the six docs behind Red Fort blast; all you need to know
description: A trans-state white-collar terror module involving doctors, clerics, and professionals, linked to Jaish-e-Mohammed and Ansar Ghazwat-ul-Hind, was unearthed after a high-intensity explosion near Delhi's Red Fort. Joint operations led to the arrest of seven suspects and the recovery of over 2,900 kg of explosives and firearms.

title: Laughs & hopes stolen: A family dinner, a b'day — stories of lives shattered near Red Fort
description: A devastating blast near Delhi's Red Fort shattered multiple lives, turning routine journeys into final goodbyes. Families are left grappling with immeasurable loss as breadwinners, on quick errands or planned reunions, perished in the tragedy, leaving behind shattered dreams and uncertain futures.

title: Early warning signs of vitamin B12 deficiency can appear in your toes
description: Early signs of vitamin B12 deficiency often manifest in the toes, with tingling, numbness, or a burning sensation indicating nerve damage. These symptoms, frequently overlooked, can lead to irreversible complications if not addressed. Recognizing these subtle indicators is crucial for timely diagnosis and treatment to protect overall nervous system health.

title: Vibe coding: Meta’s AI chief has advice for teens: Says they should spend time on..
description: Meta's AI chief, Alexandr Wang, urges teenagers to master AI tools, likening the current era to the dawn of personal computing. He advises dedicating thousands of hours to 'vibe-coding' – hands-on experimentation with AI – to gain a significant future economic advantage, much like early programmers. This rapid, iterative approach is key to understanding and maximizing AI's potential.
